Pre-Game Insights: Jaylen Brown scored a season-high 44 points and became the fourth player in franchise history to have at least 40 points and at least four steals in a regular-season game.
Brown's effort helped the Celtics end a two-game losing streak -- the first time they lost consecutive games this season.
Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton said, 'We didn't get any stops the whole night, and then offensively we didn't shoot the ball well.'
Indiana was coming off Thursday's 120-114 loss to Oklahoma City that ended the team's five-game winning streak.
